RelatedSentence: NEW YORK - Gordon Willis , the cinematographer responsible for stirring camera work in such film classics as the Godfather trilogy and several of Woody Allen 's best - known films , has died aged 82 , Hollywood publications reported on Sunday ( Monday , PHL time ) .
He was one of the giants who absolutely changed the way movies looked .
Willis received an honorary lifetime achievement Oscar in 2010 and was nominated for best cinematography Academy Awards for Allen 's Zelig and The Godfather : Part III .

In thrillers such as Alan Pakula 's The Parallax View and Klute , for which Jane Fonda won her first Oscar , Willis ' camera work evoked a dream - like , fugue state that critics credited with elevating the films to the status of classics .

The Queens , New York - born Willis worked often with Godfather director Francis Ford Coppola , Pakula and especially , Allen , with whom he made eight films .
